meanings.definition: The quality or state of being suitable or capable of being fished.
meanings.sent1: The fishability of the lake attracted many anglers.
meanings.sent2: The fishability of the river is affected by pollution levels.
meanings.sent3: The fishability of the pond made it a hotspot for fishing tournaments.
meanings.sent4: The fishability of the ocean was evident as schools of fish swam by.
meanings.sent5: The fishability of the stream was so high that even beginners could catch fish easily.

meanings.definition: The ability of a body of water to support fish populations.
meanings.sent1: The fishability of the reservoir was impressive due to its diverse fish population.
meanings.sent2: Conservation efforts improved the fishability of the lake over time.
meanings.sent3: The fishability of the pond was so good that even the fish seemed happy.
meanings.sent4: The fishability of the river was like a bustling city for aquatic life.
meanings.sent5: The fishability of the bay was crucial for the livelihood of local fishermen.
